page.title: 12Knebworth Railway Station
page.content: The railway line between London and the North was sited over 1 mile away from Old Knebworth, and so when the station was built in 1884 the new village of Knebworth was built around it. The station is well used and has 700 passengers a day, 200 of whom hold season tickets. There are only 3 full-time staff to look after the 4 platforms. 38 trains stop at Knebworth on their journey to the North as far as Royston and Cambridge, stopping at 30 minute intervals. 38 trains stop on their journey to London, stopping at 30 minute intervals. No Inter-City trains stop at Knebworth, the nearest Inter-City station being Stevenage.
